content:
If the message folders are on your PC, you can move them in one of two ways:

  1. exit thunderbird, locate the profile folder, copy the desired message folders (probably in Mail\Local Folders folder) to external media. Ignore the msf file. On the Mac, follow same process of exiting thunderbird and copying the message folder to the Mail\Local Folders folder on the Mac.
  2. option two is to install the importexporttools addon on both. then, highlight each folder, rightclick, select importexporttools option to export mbox file. Then, on the Mac, highlight Local Folders, rightclick, and select the importexportools option to import mbox. repeat as needed.

However, if you want them all in same folder, use the importexporttools option to export eml and on the Mac,highlight the desired folder, and use the importexporttools option to import eml
creator: davidsk

content:
You have a pseudo mail server in proton bridge. I suggest you ask proton if there are known issues with the bridge. I would guess there are. You can no longerbrowser the issues on github like you used to be able to, so I guess like most commercial operators they are now subscribing to security through obscurity when their encryption does not obscure issues.

However the source of the product is still published. https://github.com/ProtonMail/proton-bridge

There is also a reddit community which they push to provide support. https://reddit.com/r/ProtonMail/

content: If not done already, you could untick unified folders and then retick it. Thunderbird lists folders in the order created. That would let you have favorites at the top of the folder pane and account folders beneath.
creator: davidsk

content:
david said
If not done already, you could untick unified folders and then retick it. Thunderbird lists folders in the order created. That would let you have favorites at the top of the folder pane and account folders beneath.

I've tried that, but it didn't help with this issue. There is actually an option to move specific folder sets up or down in the menu for that pane. So my 'Favourite folders' are displayed at the top of everything. But the point is that when I scroll down to see some of my other accounts, the whole of the 'Favourites' panel scrolls off the top of the window. Making hard to simply drag a message from my 'work' account into my 'accounts' (favourite) folder. Or from my Google Play account into my 'Steam and Games' (favourite) folder.
creator: bigthicko

content: See https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/quick-folder-move/

content: Another interesting suggestion/work-around; but it still does not resolve the original issue! I don't want to be using my keyboard when reading/filing messages. How quaint! But it's also worse than right clicking and navigating through the 'move to' menus. I don't want to be navigating through 3 layers of menus, scrolling back up to the top of the folder tree, or typing in things to perform frequent moves of emails. They are passable alternatives which certainly work. But the fact is that in the Outlook I use for work, it's a zero-effort and zero-thought task to move any item from any account into a Favourite folder, and in Thunderbird it just isn't.
creator: bigthicko

content:
You need to enable the 'Message Pane' View > Layout > select 'Message Pane' Or use shortcut key - F8


Whether you have Message Pane below or to side depends upon your choice: View > Layout > 'Classic' (displays below Message List) or 'Vertical' (displays on the right of Message List)

content:
Located this regarding the error: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/exchange/updated-requirements-for-smtp-relay-through-exchange-online/3851357/replies/3974577 It specifically mentions this: "451 4.4.4 Mail received as unauthenticated, incoming to a recipient domain configured in a hosted tenant which has no mail-enabled subscriptions. ATTR5."

In Thunderbird open the Error Console

  • Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console

You could clear the Error Console, then close it Restart Thunderbird and wait for all incoming to get checked. Then try to send Open Error Console Post an image showing the contents.

Do you see something like this:

  • mailnews.smtp: Command failed: 535 Authentication unsuccessful, SmtpClientAuthentication is disabled for the Tenant. Visit https://aka.ms/smtp_auth_disabled for more information.

If yes then the issue in using SMTP maybe because SMTP has not been switched on/enabled. This is not due to Thunderbird.

The link mentioned in error console : https://aka.ms/smtp_auth_disabled That link goes to this location - I specifically include the info on 'enable smtp':

  • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/clients-and-mobile-in-exchange-online/authenticated-client-smtp-submission#enable-smtp-auth-for-specific-mailboxes

However, it would be useful to see what the Error Console is displaying.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Please note: in a Microsoft Account, all mail account/email address are regarded as 'alias' accounts.

It means you can only 'send' via smtp using whatever email address is set up as 'primary'. You can choose what is set up as primary, but it must be done via the webmail Microsoft Account accesed via a browser.

Please note: Passwords for 'alias' accounts now need to be the same as the Microsoft Account password.

In Thunderbird 'Authentication Method' for incoming and outgoing smtp must use 'Oauth2'.
creator: Toad-Hall
